title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the spaghetti until al dente, then reserve 1 cup of pasta water and drain.
While the pasta cooks, fry the guanciale in a large pan over medium heat until crispy, about 8–10 minutes. Remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, whole eggs, and most of the Pecorino. Season with plenty of black pepper.
Add the hot pasta to the pan with the guanciale. Off the heat, quickly pour in the egg mixture and toss vigorously, adding pasta water a little at a time until you have a silky sauce.
Serve immediately with the remaining Pecorino and more black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: Garlic, ginger, garam masala, salt, cilantro
instructions: Marinate the chicken in yogurt and 1 tbsp tikka paste for at least 30 minutes. Grill or broil until lightly charred and cooked through.
In a large pan, melt the butter and fry the onion until soft. Add garlic, ginger, and remaining tikka paste; cook for 2 minutes.
Add the canned tomatoes and simmer for 10–15 minutes until thickened. Blend until smooth if desired.
Stir in the cream and garam masala. Add the chicken and simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt and garnish with cilantro. Serve with rice or naan.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Crispy tortillas filled with seasoned beef, fresh salsa, and creamy guacamole.
ingredients: Salsa, shredded lettuce, grated cheese, sour cream
instructions: Brown the ground beef in a skillet over medium-high heat, breaking it up with a spoon. Drain excess fat, then add taco seasoning and a splash of water. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Warm the tortillas in a dry pan or over a flame until slightly charred.
Make guacamole by mashing the avocado with lime juice and salt.
Assemble tacos: fill tortillas with beef, then top with salsa, lettuce, cheese, sour cream, and guacamole. Serve with lime wedges.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
summary: Colorful vegetables tossed in a savory soy-ginger sauce, ready in minutes.
ingredients: Sesame seeds and green onion for garnish
instructions: Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add garlic and ginger; stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the harder vegetables (carrot, broccoli) and stir-fry for 2–3 minutes. Add bell pepper and snap peas; stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame oil in a small bowl. Pour over the vegetables and toss for 1 minute until everything is coated and glossy.
Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onion. Serve with rice or noodles.
